name: Custom Whimsical Head Portrait
description:
Black inked head portrait of an animal with whimsical colours.
Rabbit shown in example but I can draw any pet or animal's head portrait, from the most flattering photo of him or her that you provide.
This will be hand drawn with ink onto thick Art paper, to the likeness of the photo.
Slight differences and imperfect lines are part of the charm of this head portrait. It show the hand drawn authenticity and impulse (and skill :) ? ) of straight pen to paper, no drafting, tracing, or digital work used here!
Colours used will be imaginary! Please let me know if you have a colour preference to match your room, or want your favourite colours used, or even if you like a certain palette for example Easter pastels, or Dr Seuss colours. Otherwise I will happily use my own judgement and whimsy.

Specifications: Ink, watercolour, plus alcohol based markers on Archival 280gsm thick canvas textured cotton paper
Art work measures 13cm x 9cm (5" x 3 1/2") 
Paper outer edge is approximately A4  21cm x 26cm (8" x 10.5").
Frame (for framed option) is a black or white, bevelled edge frame made of wood from sustainable plantation in Queensland. 
Frame measures 32cm x 27cm x 2cm (12 3/4" x 10 3/4" x 1")

name: Custom Full Portraiture 1 Animal
description:
Custom portraiture of your pet or loved one's pet. 
This portrait will be hand drawn from photos and stories you provide via correspondence. An individual, once-off bespoke piece of fine Art created to be framed and hung on the wall in your home. 
From my own experience with the passing of my own dear pet, there was no photograph that could show what a big personality she had and what she was to me.  
My style tries to show spirit of the pet, painting their portrait with character and personality, and showing what he or she is to their owner.
I can create the portrait from my own ideas of your photos and description, and I can also draw up something very specific if you can describe it! From an 18th Century Count, to a more simple holding of a favourite toy, or contemoprary wearing the owner's favourite designer, or hat. I've done all of these before!

Process
1. After payment is recieved, I will send an email asking for some photos and description of your pet and any specific details you want. 
2. I will draft up a sketch and show you, or if you didn't have a particular vision of the portrait I will do a few different sketches of your pet for you to choose from.  
3. After your feedback, I will then redraw a new clean final draft and show you. I can only make ONE other change here (otherwise this step can go on forever!). 
4. The painting and inking of the portrait is then done, and no changes can be made. Usually I choose the colours for all the clothes to either mimic or compliment the fur pattern and colour of the animal.    
5. If you like I can then send out a preview pic of the finished painting, or wait to be surprised in the mail!

The whole process takes around 10 days- 3 weeks if it is during the busy season. The portrait will be framed (for framing option) and packaged safely for postage via Australia Post to anywhere in the world. 
Please allow 1-3 weeks depending on where you are in the world for postage from Western Australia.  

Specifications: Paper is archival 280gsm thick Art paper, mostly watercolour, ink and a touch of graphite is used for the painting. 
Art work usually measures 14cm x 8cm (4" x 2.5") for a single pet. 
Paper outer edge measures 21cm x 26cm (8" x 10.5").
Frame (for framed option) is a black or white, bevelled edge frame made of wood from sustainable plantation in Queensland. 
Frame measures 32cm x 27cm x 2cm (12 3/4" x 10 3/4" x 1")

name: Panther Girl giclee print LIMITED only 1!!
description:
This is a beautiful large A3 print, giclee printed at a special Art printer as a one off. The paper is very thick and beautiful quality, a cotton rag watecolour paper. The colours are intense and exactly like the original painting. 
The Art printers moved away and also A3 prints have proven costly to do as well a jump in postage and packaging costs, so subsequent copies will be done as archival A4 prints.  This is a rare one off piece!
The original painting was gallery exhibited in 2012 as part of a group Art exhibition called "Bestiolas" and was done around the time of Halloween so I chose to do the token black cat, but my favourite wild animal. I did her as a young panther in the playground would be, still a kid with her cute toy duck, but nevertheless dangerous as all panthers are. Something different for a girl's nursery room for the strong, won't be pushed around little girl!   
It will be numbered as the limited one off giclee, and signed. 
r.r.p. in the gallery was $110.00

name: "Owl Candy" Original or print ($40)
description:
Original Painting $120
Archival Print $40

The Boobook Owl is Australia's smallest owl.
I often draw them at the zoo and I've been wanting to paint one in a portrait for ages so I finally drew one specially for this Halloween. 

The original is watercolour, graphite, and ink on paper.
Print is archival on 280gsm thick Art paper with archival ink. Each print will be hand signed and numbered by the Artist.

Art work measures 15cm x 7.5cm (6" x 3")
Paper outer edge measures 29cm x 21cm (8 1/4" x 11 3/4")

Frame (for framed option) is a black, multi-bevelled edge frame made of wood from a sustainable plantation in Queensland.
size  32cm x 27cm x 2cm (12 1/2" x 10 3/4" x 3/4")

name: Custom Full Portraiture 2 Animals
description:
Custom portraiture of two pets. 
This portrait will be hand drawn from photos and stories you provide via correspondence. An individual, once-off bespoke piece of fine Art created to be framed and hung on the wall in your home. 
From my own experience with the passing of my own dear pet, there was no photograph that could show what a big personality she had and what she was to me.  
My style tries to show spirit of your pets, painting their portrait with character and personality, and what they are to their owners.
I am happy to create the portrait from my own ideas of your photos, and I can also draw up something very specific if you can describe it, eg the 18th Century poodles! Or a more simple idea, holding of a favourite toy. Or maybe contemporary for example wearing the owner's favourite designer, or hat, I've done these all before!

Process
1. After payment is recieved, I will send an email asking for some photos and description of the pets and any specific details if you have any. 
2. I will draft up a sketch and show you, or if you didn't have a particular vision of the portrait I will do a few different sketches of the duo for you to choose from.  
3. After your feedback, I will redraw a new clean final draft to show you. I can only make ONE other change here (otherwise this process can go on forever!). 
4. The painting and inking of the portrait then begins and no changes can be made at this stage. Usually I choose the colours for all the clothes to either mimic or compliment the fur pattern and colour of the animal.    
5. If you like I can then send out a preview pic of the finished painting, or wait to be surprised in the mail!

The whole process takes around 10 days- 3 weeks if it is during the busy season. The portrait will be framed (for framing option) and packaged safely for postage via Australia Post to anywhere in the world. 
Please allow 1-3 weeks depending on where you are in the world for postage from Western Australia.  

Specifications: Paper is archival 280gsm thick Art paper, mostly watercolour, ink and a touch of graphite is used for the painting. 
Art work usually measures 15cm x 13cm for two pets, slightly more if an item like a chair is included.  
Paper outer edge measures 25cm x 30cm (10" x 12").
Frame (for framed option) is a black or white, bevelled edge frame made of wood from sustainable plantation in Queensland. 
Frame measures 33cm x 38cm x 2cm (13" x 15" x 1")

name: "Koala in a Bowler Hat" original or print ($60)
description:
Original Painting $230
Print $60.00

Watercolour paint and Ink over hand drawn by Australian Artist Roseline Lau. No.2 of 8 portrait series around the theme of Oz - both the movie and home Australia.

Original is painted on 300gsm Art paper in watercolour and ink.
Art work 6.5cm 10.5cm (2 1/2' x 4 1/4')
Dimensions 15cmx20cm (6"x8", A5)
Print is archival on 280gsm thick Art paper with archival ink.
Dimensions 20cmx25cm (8"x10", A4)

Frame (for framed option) is a black or white, bevelled edge frame made of wood from sustainable plantation in Queensland.
Frame size  27cm x 22cm x 1cm (10 1/2" x 8 3/4" x 1/3")

name: "Sir Stork" original or print ($65)
description:
Print $65

Part of a series "Oz" consisting of 8 watercolour paintings, hand drawn by Australian artist Roseline Lau. 
"Sir Stork" March 2013
This is the Black Necked Stork of Australia, Ephippiorhynchus asiaticus, and it is the only stork species found in Australia. The female has yellow eyes while the male has brown eyes. They are sometimes called the Jabiru as they are found in the Northern Territory around the town of Jabiru where I travelled once but I wasn't lucky enough to see one in the wild. I have often sketched them at the Perth Zoo and up close they make people gasp when they see them for the first time because of their large, stalkish but gentle presence.  They are a gigantic bird, standing at 1.5m high! 

Original is painted with watercolour and ink on 300gsm watercolour paper, size of paper is 21cm x 26cm (8 1/4" x 10 1/4").
Print is archival on 200gsm art paper with archival ink and the image is kept the same size.
Print paper size 28cm x 35cm (11" x 14")

Frame (for framed option) is a matte black, bevelled edge frame made of wood from sustainable plantation in Queensland.
size 32.5cm x 38cm x 1.7 cm (12 3/4" x 15" x 1/2")

name: Set of 6 postcards - October Series
description:
Six postcard set of animal portraits selected for the month of Halloween. 
Tochi the Cat, Panther Girl, Sad Loris Clown, Sir and Madam Stork, and Owl Candy.
All of the original Art work were created for varioius clients and Gallery exhibitions throughout 2012-2013, 
and the Boobook Owl was freshly painted in October 2013 especially for this card set! 

Postcards are standard size and a mixture of glossy and matte.
Each of them have a small paragraph on the back about the inspiration behind the individual painting.

name: Set of 4 Postcards - Lepus Australis
description:
Four glossy postcards of the Artwork I created for the Lepus Australis Exhibit in Melbourne July 2013. 

ALl four original paintings were A3 in size and the famous Surfboards Buns sold, and was the Gallery hung painting. The other three were not displayed in the gallery and are currenly not for sale. 

Postcards are standard size and beautifully glossy, each with a small paragraph on the back about the inspiration behind the individual painting.
